block.p: Radio Host Is Suspended Over Racial Comments CBS Radio and MSNBC suspended Don Imus, the morning talk host, for two weeks after his racially disparaging comments about the Rutgers women's basketball team. MSNBC said Mr. Imus had agreed that the suspension was appropriate and promised to change the tenor of the program.

Sex Offender Roils Church A church in Carlsbad, Calif., has been plunged into a painful dilemma by the request of a convicted child molester to join. Congregants are asking how to ensure the safety of their children and wondering if an offender who says he has accepted Christ has truly changed.

Ex-Captives Can't Sell Stories After howls of protest, Britain's defense secretary abruptly reversed a decision to allow some of the sailors and marines captured by Iran to sell their stories to the media. Two of them already have.
Retirement As life spans lengthen, experts on aging say it is more important than ever to prepare for the physical and psychological aspects of retirement.

The Science of Desire Scientists are gaining new and surprising insights into the nature of sexual desire. They are tracing the differences and similarities in how men and women respond, studying what makes some people straight and others gay, and even analyzing speed dating to determine what turns people on -- and off.

Iran Claims Nuclear Progress Iran claimed that it was now capable of industrial-scale uranium enrichment, a development that would defy two United Nations resolutions passed to press it to suspend its enrichment program. Western diplomats and nuclear experts were skeptical about Iran's progress.

The Woman in the 'Moon' In her Broadway debut, Eve Best plays Josie Hogan, Eugene O'Neill's rural giantess, in ''A Moon for the Misbegotten,'' which opened last night at the Brooks Atkinson Theater. A review by Ben Brantley.

Mets' Hearty Welcome Home In front of 56,227 fans, the largest turnout for a home opener in franchise history, the Mets scored seven runs in the eighth inning to beat the Philadelphia Phillies, 11-5, at Shea Stadium.
